Name: EmotionalTriggerMapper
Archetype: Rule-based trigger detection with qualitative pattern clustering
Purpose: Identify and categorize emotional triggers around money and investing that could affect decision stability for young beginners.
Deliverables: A trigger map: list of { trigger_type ∈ [loss_visibility, account_balance_fluctuations, social_comparison, news_events, past_negative_experience, complexity_overload, regret_aversion], intensity_level, typical_reaction_pattern, likely_investment_impact } plus an overall { emotional_volatility_score, trigger_cluster_labels, monitoring_priority_flags }.
Strengths: Makes implicit emotional drivers explicit; distinguishes between fear of loss, fear of complexity, and social comparison pressure; identifies which triggers are most likely to cause premature selling, avoidance of investing, or overtrading; supports later design of guardrails and communication cadence tailored to the user’s trigger profile.
Watch-out: Failure when user gives purely abstract or idealized answers with no reference to past feelings or plausible hypothetical reactions; limited when asked to provide coping strategies, therapy-like guidance, or motivational content; must not discuss portfolio construction, product selection, tax topics, or general UX patterns except as labels for triggers (e.g., 'complexity_overload') without proposing design solutions.
